citeinfo.title: National Pollution Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) Wastewater Treatment Plant Points, Region 9, 2007, US EPA Region 9

descript.abstract: Point geospatial dataset representing locations of NPDES Waste Water Treatment Plant Facilities. NPDES (National Pollution Discharge Elimination System) is an EPA permit program that regulates direct discharges from facilities that discharge treated waste water into waters of the US. Facilities are issued NPDES permits regulating their discharge as required by the Clean Water Act. A facility may have one or more outfalls (dischargers). The location represents the facility or operating plant.
descript.purpose: This data is specifically designed for use with ArcGIS and related software. This data set is useful for determining locations and general information about dischargers.
descript.supplinf: The data was extracted from PCS and ICIS, imported into a spreadsheet and delivered to the R9 GIS Center for processing. Latitude and longitude data is furnished by the US EPA, Region 9. Latitude-longitude data was generated into a point feature, projected to geographic NAD83. Some facility locations were acquired from the original permit application. Sites that failed the QA process were located using Google Earth.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.2 (Build 3790) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypl: R9 NPDES Waste Water Treatment Plants

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
3 letter abbreviation for facility owner type

idCitation.resTitle: National Pollution Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) Wastewater Treatment Plant Points, Region 9, 2007, US EPA Region 9

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Point geospatial dataset representing locations of NPDES Waste Water Treatment Plant Facilities. NPDES (National Pollution Discharge Elimination System) is an EPA permit program that regulates direct discharges from facilities that discharge treated waste water into waters of the US. Facilities are issued NPDES permits regulating their discharge as required by the Clean Water Act. A facility may have one or more outfalls (dischargers). The location represents the facility or operating plant.

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at http://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html

procstep.procdesc: Facilities data were extracted from the PCS and ICIS databases at the US EPA Region 9. The PCS Database Administrator facilitated the data extraction. Latitude-Longitude values have been determined by the US EPA Region 9 personnel. New facilitites were address geocoded. SIC code = 4952 was used to extract waste water treatment plants (sewage treatment plants). Where address geocoding failed, other methods were used to determine locations such as Envirofacts. Facility furnished latitude-longitude values were used when other methods failed. All data was QA'ed by GIS personnel for accuracy within county and city limits using Tele Atlas county and city boundary data.
Data set processed into a feature class

All facility locations were verified using air photos. Facilities that failed this step were located using Google Earth. A few facilities could not be verified, therefore, the latitude-longitude values taken from ICIS/PCS were used.
